intro: Panax pseudoginseng subsp. himalaicus, commonly known as Himalayan ginseng, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain the seeds, and it is valued for its root, which is used in traditional medicine. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it distinct from other ginseng species, with unique chemical compositions that contribute to its medicinal properties.
